item.title: Senior UX Architect
item.description:
• Senior UX Architect

      Waterloo, Ontario
        Toronto, Ontario
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        Digital User Experience team in our Client Experience Office is looking for a creative and inventive Senior UX Architect with significant UX and Product Design experience. This role will support a major Group Benefits initiative, combining predictive data modeling and information visualization techniques to deliver next generation tools for internal and external users. We are looking for an innovative, data-obsessed designer who can combine contextual research, systems thinking, and data visualization to deliver an intelligent experience that helps our teams make better decisions in real-time.

        What you will do:

        • Apply user-centered design principles to influence project strategy and direction
        • Conduct user research to discover insights, refine user personas, and identify key jobs to be done/user problems to solve
        • Take ownership and drive UX strategy – find the intersection of user needs and data model strengths to deliver unique value for our target users
        • Help establish UI patterns for delivering intelligent recommendations and assistance within Sun Life’s experiences
        • Assess and articulate the difference between tasks that can be automated vs. augmented using intelligent software, and design to account for both
        • Develop user scenarios, user flows, design concepts, low and high-fidelity wireframes, and prototypes, UI standards documents, and other design documents as needed.
        • Conduct concept and usability testing to iteratively validate and improve design solutions
        • Actively collaborate as part of the team to ensure designs are feasible and implemented accurately
        • Track user experience metrics and analytics, including reporting on the success of UX improvements
        • Ensure standards and best practices are appropriately communicated and documented. 
        • Collaborate with product stakeholders to ensure a clear understanding of user needs and problems to be solved
        • Manage user experience deliverables as required to ensure expectations are successfully met
        • Lead the production of annotated wireframes, design specs and other documentation as needed within all project timelines
        • Ensure proposed workflows reflect user needs and maintain consistency across features/platforms
        • Determine the need for user research and user testing; then orchestrate and oversee the process
        • Review, interpret, and share research findings with project teams, working to build a shared understanding of user needs and pain points

        What you will need to succeed:

        • 5+ years of experience in user-centered digital design and user experience
        • Portfolio demonstrating impactful user experiences, including experience developing digital products from initial concept through to implementation.
        • Demonstrable experience with data/information visualization techniques, and designing interfaces that use data to help users make decisions
        • Strong knowledge and experience designing wireframes and interactive prototypes using industry software (Sketch, inVision, Figma, Axure, etc.)
        • Experience working with design systems that consistently scale across platforms
        • Familiarity with intelligent recommendation patterns/best practices for visualizing the outputs of machine learning models
        • Growth mindset and an openness to taking on new challenges and learning new concepts/skills
        • Experience in financial services/financial software a major asset
        • Experience working in Agile methodology also an asset

        What’s in it for you:

        • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
        • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
        • An environment of continuous learning and improvement
        • Flexible hours and periodic work from home options

item.title: Senior Strategy Consultant
item.description:
• Senior Strategy Consultant

      Toronto, Ontario
    Apply

    • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

      Job Description:

      Role Summary

      This role will provide planning, strategic thought leadership and internal consulting support to senior executives within Enterprise Technology and to our various business partners throughout the organization. Particular focus for this role will be in the area of research and competitive intelligence gathering and synthesis for review by participants in our digital transformation.

      What will you do?

      The Senior Strategy Consultant main accountabilities include, but are not limited to:

      • Strategy and innovation – Support the CIO, our Technology executives, delivery teams and our business partners to define and advance our strategic ambitions.

      • Digital transformation – Lead key initiatives within Sun Life’s digital transformation programs—our drive to embrace agile principles at scale to deliver leading client experiences on our digital platforms—including the target operating model,  organizational design, digital metrics and objectives, and coordinating regular executive workshops and meetings.

      • Technology metrics – Develop, socialize and manage digital metrics, objectives and key results (OKRs), and balanced scorecard that provide insights on the progress towards operational and transformational technology ambitions.

      • Engagement and external outreach – Remain abreast of external trends in the digital space by participating in the start-up, FinTech and InsurTech communities, connect with vendor partners, attend external conferences, and participate in analyst calls (e.g., Gartner, Forrester, Celent, etc.) with the goal of establishing new connections, promoting Sun Life’s digital transformation, and bringing learnings back to the Sun Life team.

      • Digital evangelism – Increase the presence of IT across the organization in executive-level communications, reporting and business development.

      What will you need to succeed?

      • Five or more years of experience relevant to the accountabilities listed above.

      • A post-secondary or equivalent degree with a focus (i.e. major) on one of the following:

        • Engineering or Technology, with supporting education or experience in business management.

        • Business Management, with supporting education or experience in digital technology

        • Humanities or Communications, with supporting education or experience in both business management and digital technology.

      • Excellent and demonstrated MS PowerPoint skills, including an understanding of presentation process (storyboard to finished product and speaker notes).

      • Excellent and demonstrated MS Excel skills in the context of financial management, including the corresponding ability to visualize, interpret and report results.

      • Excellent communication skills, written and oral. Writing skills include an ability to translate technical content into laymen terms consumable by senior executive readers (C-suite, board of directors).

      • Demonstrated interest in digital technology, digital innovation.

      • Superior interpersonal skills and the ability to navigate and build relationships in a large organization

      What will be nice to have?

      • Experience with executive communications, e.g., workshops, reporting to C-Suite or external audience.

      • Management or technology consulting experience.

      • Experience in the FinTech, InsurTech or traditional financial services.

      • Specialized experience in any of the following enterprise technologies: application programming interface (API), data & analytics (“big data”), cloud infrastructure, DevOps, cyber security, web or mobile development.

      • Experience with agile delivery methodologies.

      What\'s in it for you?

      • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

      • Entitlement to flexible benefits, pension, stocks, savings and 4 weeks vacation

      • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

      The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

      Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

      Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

      At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

      We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

item.title: Business Systems Consultant
item.description:
• Business Systems Consultant

      North York, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Toronto One York
          Sun Life Financial Waterloo King
        Apply

        • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

          Job Description:

          The Data & Analytics team is a global team that enables Sun Life to be a data-driven organization by making relevant, timely and trusted data easily and securely available.  The D&A Delivery team is looking for a Business Systems Consultant who can combine expert analysis skills, a strong technical aptitude, a strategic mindset, diplomatic facilitation and leadership skills to elicit and build requirements that enable exceptional solutions. We operate in a world where time-to-market and evolving business priorities drive our plans so the person who fills this role will need to be equally effective in adapting to change as they are following a process.

          What will you do?

          • Identify and assist in the re-engineering, improvement or replacement of existing business processes and associated technology
          • Elicit, document, examine and manage business requirements on projects by following the current company development methodology. This involves managing business requirements sessions, conducting interviews and accessing existing documentation
          • Coordinate and facilitate business requirements gathering sessions, gap analysis, risk assessment and business requirements validation
          • Translate the business requirements into functional requirements. 
          • Engage IT resources such as architects, designers, developers, and the testing team at the appropriate times

          What you need to succeed?

          • University degree in Business or technology
          • 5-10+ years of experience as a business systems analyst involved in all phases of a project life cycle with proven track record of success on large multi-year projects.
          • Proven capability with agile, lean or process improvement methodology
          • Strong knowledge and experience using business analysis principles and industry best practices (eg. business process modeling, conceptual data modeling) and tools, highly developed analysis, research,  organization and problem solving skills
          • Ability to collaborate in a global multi-site environment and working in a matrix environment, onshore/offshore IT model

          Preferred skills;

          • Strong leadership skills with the ability to bring opinions, comments and thoughts forward.  Able to drive discussions and manage business meetings to meet objectives
          • Ability to think strategically and understand the big picture of a situation or issue and offer alternative viable strategies

item.description:
• Business Consultant

      Toronto, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Waterloo King
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        Job Description:

        The Business Consultant, will support the Data and Analytics initiatives for Finance by effectively managing the assigned projects from concept to execution.  The successful candidate brings strong technical and communication skills and is comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with multiple priorities. You have a track record of leading, or partnering, to achieve sustainable, measurable performance improvement in a consultative, collaborative role.  You have first-hand experience delivering results in a complex environment.

        What will you do?

        • Perform business analysis and document detailed business and technical requirements to include but not limited to data mapping tables, data and process flow charts.
        • Facilitate working groups and collaborate with various business partners to drive results and achieve project objectives.
        • Effective management of projects to deliver on time, on cost and according to project objectives agreed.
        • Accountable to leadership for results and progress
        • Support the Director in building out the Data Governance and Management Reporting Delivery work streams.

        What do you need to succeed?

        • Project execution skills with experience taking project objectives from concept to detailed requirements in a matrix environment
        • Technology savvy and ability to work effectively with subject matter experts (SMEs) in the respective areas.
        • Strong research, analytical and problem solving skills
        • Strong planning, coordination, and organizational skills
        • Ability to independently shape, produce, and deliver ideas, presentations, and documentation across all levels of management.
        • Ability to independently define how to approach work, engage and influence stakeholders including navigating in a matrix organization, manage through ambiguity, address challenges and meet timelines to deliver the work.
        • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
        • Demonstrated business analysis and project management skills and experience 
        • Comfort in working with all levels of management
        • Enthusiastic learner eager to explore and contribute

        Assets:

        • Familiarity with Sun Life Financial business practices, processes and systems.
        • Understanding of Finance and accounting
        • Broad knowledge and deep understanding of the insurance business.
        • Developing Tableau dashboards

        Education and Experience:

        • University Degree preferably in Actuarial Science, Data Management, Computer Science, Information Technology and/or 7+ years of relevant experience with increasing responsibilities
        • Demonstrated analytical, facilitation and change management skills, along with experience managing complex data governance and management reporting delivery projects
        • Expert level knowledge of tools to collect, aggregate, segment and analyze data e.g. MS Excel
        • Knowledge of MS PowerPoint, MS Project, and MS Visio

item.title: Intermediate Database Analyst
item.description:
• Intermediate Database Analyst

      North York, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Waterloo King
          Sun Life Financial Montreal De Gaspe
        Apply

        • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

          Job Description:

          About the Role:

          The candidate will be a member of a team within Data & Analytics - Data Management Services (DMS) called Alternative Database Technologies. Alternative Database Technologies team is responsible for support various cloud based and on-premise database platforms. The successful candidate will have a passion for database related technologies and will need to be able to pick up, understand and become proficient in a wide range of database products in a short period of time. This is an opportunity for someone who is willing to become an expert in multiple database platforms and architectures, including NoSQL and SQL, OLTP, and OLAP. An ideal candidate would have 3 to 5 years of experience in relational and non-relational database technologies such as Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB etc. We also welcome new graduates majored in computer engineering, computer science or other computer-related majors and who have a satisfying GPA, the ambition, and the confidence to learn on the job.

          What will you do?

          • Key Responsibilities include: Provision MongoDB instances; Ensure performance, security, and availability of databases; Prepare documentations and specifications; Handle common database procedures, such as upgrade, backup, recovery, migration, etc.; Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders; perform upgrades to MongoDB environments
          • Manage small to medium size infrastructure projects
          • Participate in projects throughout the entire project lifecycle, and define, manage, and track project deliverables using defined technologies
          • Maintain up-to-date documentation and procedures for MongoDB and other supported database platforms
          • Keep up to date on current and upcoming technology innovations for use within Sunlife
          • Develop scripts to support the database operations on Linux, Unix or cloud-based platforms
          • Support project development following documented standards, policies and procedures (Change Management Process)
          • Participate in a rotational on-call schedule
          • Participate, on occasion, in after-hours and weekend support of production implementations, infrastructure activities, and various disaster recovery exercises
          • Work closely with other team members, technical/team leads, management, specialized IT areas and application support teams to ensure consistent delivery and quality of database services
          • Define, document, and implement consistent standards and procedures
          • Contribute ideas for best practice improvements, process improvement, and innovative solutions

          What you need to succeed:

          • University degree in Computer Science or related information technology degree/diploma
          • 3+ years of experience working with multiple platforms and types of data repositories (Relational, NOSQL, Datawarehouse, OLAP, OLTP etc.)
          • New graduates majored in computer engineering, computer science or other computer-related majors are welcome
          • Experience/familiarity with the operations and maintenance of production database systems
          • Understanding of schema design (relational and MongoDB), index design, operation optimization, query (or explain) plans
          • Experienced in Performance Tuning, Query Optimization, Client/Server Connectivity, and Database Consistency Checks using different Utilities
          • Experienced in Object-oriented programming in order to write robust and re-usable code
          • Involved in designing, developing, testing and rolling out of complex enterprise applications to completion in terms of Database as well as frontend. With different project development model like SDLC, Agile, SCRUM etc.
          • Expert of writing shell scripting, Perl script for Linux/Unix.
          • Problem solving, technical and conceptual skills
          • Ability to lead technical discussions and self-manage workloads
          • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
          • Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask efficiently
          • Ability to contribute solutions that meet or exceed business requirements

          What’s in it for you:

          • Joining an organization that the industry calls ‘one of the best places to work’
          • Being part of our journey in developing the next greatest digital experience
          • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family
          • Wellness programs that support the three pillars of your health – mental, physical and financial
          • An extensive support system for continual learning including company-run courses, access to online learning platforms, opportunity for rotations, etc.
          • A flexible work schedule, as long as it includes core working hours

          The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

          We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

item.title: Process Improvement Consultant
item.description:
• Process Improvement Consultant

      Toronto, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Waterloo King
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        About Lumino Health:

        To support the vision of helping Canadians live healthier lives, Sun Life created the largest network of health resources in Canada – Lumino Heath. The vision behind this two-sided network is to allow Canadians complete access to easily searchable healthcare resources and providers including dentists, physiotherapists, massage therapists, chiropractors, and more.

        Through this, we\'ve developed a marketing solution that helps these providers grow their practice, retain patients, and simplify their marketing efforts. An innovative new way for providers to market their practice and connect with more patients on a trusted and wide-reaching health network. The network is available to our 6 million Sun Life clients and now to all Canadians on LuminoHealth.ca.

        “In virtually every other industry, we have access to information about services before we use them. We can compare the cost, ratings and services for hotels, vacations, and restaurants. Health care needs to catch up. It’s time we had resources that are up to the task of connecting Canadians with the right care.” - Chris Denys, Senior Vice President of Possibilities, Lumino Health

        About the role:

        As a key member of the Lumino Health team, the Product & Process Consultant is accountable for implementing sales and operational processes for new product launches and platform releases while driving efficiency and effectiveness of the existing end to end sales and operations process.  Reporting to the AVP Strategy, Provider Relationship Management and Sales Enablement, you will work collaboratively with Sales, Finance, Analytics, and technology teams to transform business concepts and ideas into processes and digital solutions.

        This role is responsible for the development of processes, training curriculum, and high-profile project execution within the team.  This role also acts as the Salesforce expert, shares knowledge, and provides subject-matter related coaching to the sales teams.

        Ideal candidates for this role are self starters that are passionate about process, discovery business pain points, building comprehensive process flows, and implementing solutions that enhance efficiency, quality, and outcomes for our clients.

        What will you do?

        Product & Process Ownership (50%):

        • Advocate for the sales experience, owning issues and outcomes to move the client experience forward
        • Maintain a firm understanding of client needs and pain points and remain at the leading edge of existing market solutions and their components
        • Develop and roll out new processes for all Lumino Health sales projects
        • Champion continuous improvement initiatives: review and assess processes to increase operational efficiency
        • Support the planning and implementation of projects, programs, or initiatives to support delivery on Lumino Health sales objectives
        • Facilitate and encourage the sharing of knowledge between Lumino Health Sales teams

        Projects (35%):

        • Lead Lumino Health Sales projects; projects may include creation and/or review of quality program, large-scale improvement ideas, process reengineering, etc.
          • Develop plans and timelines, secure resourcing, communicate progress
          • Identify and manage issues
          • Roll out and training on the changes
        • Participate in high-profile projects on the sales platforms, representing the Lumino Health Sales area in terms of business needs, process development, training preparation and all associated analytical and financial reporting needs
        • Work collaboratively and communicate effectively with Lumino Health and supporting teams, including Business Projects & Solutions (BPS), to achieve goals and deliverables

        Training (15%):

        • Partner with the Sales leaders in the development and implementation of onboarding, training, and education programs for all Lumino Health Sales staff
        • Work with SMEs on the Sales Operations teams to create content for training
        • Work with Sales Leadership to leverage insights from the errors and quality programs to identify training gaps and create action plans to address them
        • Liaise with Sales leaders to develop and implement learning modules
        • Update and maintain training materials

        What you need to succeed?

        • University degree in business or related degree
        • Minimum 5 years of related work experience with proof of delivering on projects and enhancing processes
        • Extensive understanding and experience of Salesforce
        • Strong skills at process definition and optimization, developing and building upon best practices
        • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
        • Excellent communication skills (listening, understanding, responding, written and verbal)
        • Comfortable delivering presentations to diverse audiences for training or solution review sessions
        • Advanced in MS Office and Visio

        What’s in it for you:

        • Being a member of the Sun Life family, a group of people united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier live
        • A friendly, collaborative, and inclusive culture
        • An environment of continuous learning and improvement

        The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

        Product

item.title: SAP S4/HANA Developer
item.description:
• SAP S4/HANA Developer

      North York, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Waterloo King
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        Role Summary:

        The Corporate Applications Services (CAS) IT team is looking for an SAP S4/HANA Developer. With strong analytical skills and expertise in SAP S4/HANA development to take part in the SAP S/4 and BW/4 HANA implementation project and become a member of the SAP Support team going forward.

        The person in this role will be designing, developing implementing and maintaining RICEFW objects utilizing SAP S4/HANA technologies including but not limited to ABAP/4, Fiori and CDS.

        The role will work with business analysts, designers, architects, business partners and project management to understand the requirements, and design reporting solutions that meet the business needs. 

        Within the operations support component of the role, you will be responding to incidents, service requests, problem solving, maintaining stability, performing technical implementations, coordinate activities and work together with the team members and vendors to maintain, enhance and customize the supported systems and components

        Main accountabilities:

        • Development of SAP RICEFW objects in accordance to the user requirement and unit-test/deliver as per the project plan.
        • Provide estimates and contribute to defining timelines and project plans
        • Support requirements gathering of the end-to-end solution development for Fiori, S4/HANA embedded reporting and Group Reporting.​
        • Assist the functional project team with draft of functional specifications for Standard FIORI, S4/HANA data models and views.​
        • Provide the functional team with the necessary guidance of the SAP-provided enhancements (implicit and explicit ones)
        • Work on change and service requests as well as defect fixes across the AP, FA, GL, and integration modules
        • Performance tracing and optimization (for the existing RICE objects)
        • Work with project management to document and communicate risks and issues.  
        • Work with onshore, offshore and 3rd party development teams to ensure coding, testing, debugging and implementation activities are completed as required
        • Ensure alignment to Sun Life SDLC and internal standards and compliance
        • Transition projects and enhancements to Operations
        • Support our operational team as needed with problem analysis, resolution, escalation and reporting
        • Collaborate closely with our internal teams (e.g. data architects, designers, business to business, business intelligence/reporting, server management, etc.) to deliver solutions for business needs.

        Core competencies:

        • Strong ability to work independently with a bias toward action and results
        • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to assess situations/problems systematically and deliver effective right-sized solutions in a timely manner
        • Excellent organizing, planning and time management skills with the ability to multi-task
        • Ability to learn quickly and ramp up on new technologies, systems and business concepts
        • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
        • Experience writing technical documentation that articulates the design of the reporting solution

        Qualifications/Skills:

        • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education, training or work experience
        • Proficient in the development of RICEFW deliverables (Reports, Interfaces, Conversions, Enhancements, Forms)
        • 5+ years’ experience with ABAP, preferably 7.4+ (including Object-Oriented ABAP, New Enhancement Framework, OData services, SAP Workflow etc.)
        • 5+ years’ experience with RICEFW objects in SAP
        • 2+ years’ experience with SAP FIORI and UI5 technologies (Basic FLP configuration, standard apps’ activation, UI5 applications architecture, basic JavaScript, Front End debugging)
        • Prior experience with SAP FI/CO or Group Reporting solution, as well as business knowledge in the areas related to accounting, controlling, planning or general Finance
        • Expertise in system integration, job flows relative to data integration
        • Experience working with large volumes of transactional data
        • Familiarity with SAP authorization concept
        • Experience with developing SAP S4/HANA CDS Views
        • Working knowledge of relational and OLAP databases
        • Experience with SDLC methodologies: Agile, Waterfall
        • Experience working with application vendors and building solutions involving integrating vendor applications into existing environment.
        • Experience with creating effective design documentation and diagrams

        Other relevant assets:

        • Certification: SAP Certified Development Associate ABAP and/or HANA
        • Experience with SAP Group Reporting tool
        • Experience with SAP AIF
        • Experience with SAP NetWeaver Application Server (understanding of the Basis components and how they interact)
        • Familiar with SAP Data Migration tools – LSMW and LTMC
        • Familiar with SAP Design Studio reporting
        • Familiar with Solution Manager, CHARM
        • Familiar with SAP AFO tools (Analysis For Office)
        • Familiar with SAP Business Warehouse (BW), SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)
        • Familiar with DevOps Tools (Git, BitBucket, Gradle, Jenkins)
        • Familiar with AWS (Amazon Web Services) IaaS platform
        • Knowledge/experience with Linux systems
        • Knowledge/experience with scripting languages (e.g. bash, Windows scripting, Powershell)
        • Experience working with geographically distributed and third-party development teams

        Notes / unique requirements:

        • Eligible or RCMP (Government Data) clearance
        • Occasional work outside of normal business hours as part of a global team
        • Occasional weekend work in support of project delivery and implementations
        • Occasional travel may be required depending on work assignments

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

      Job Description:

      About the Business:

      Sun Life Financial is a leader and innovator in engaging Canadians through digital channels, putting our clients at the centre of everything we do. The Sun Life Salesforce Centre of Excellence (CoE) Team is a dynamic group of people, building and supporting exciting mission critical solutions for business areas across Sun Life Canada.  The Salesforce.com platform is a key enabler helping us deliver on our Purpose: To help our Clients achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives.

      About the Role:

                                                                                               

      The Salesforce CoE team is growing and looking for a business-minded Salesforce Developer who can work with Salesforce technical lead for complex Salesforce.com implementations. The successful candidate will work closely with business partners and other IT teams to design, develop, and implement Enterprise scale and integrated Salesforce.com solutions.

      What will you do?

      • Contribute to the design and development of Salesforce.com solutions, following internal guidelines and standard processes.
      • Provide thought leadership and recommendations for how all aspects of the Salesforce platform can advance Sun Life’s digital transformation.
      • Work closely with internal business partners as a functional consultant. 
      • Develop and demonstrate Proof of Concept (PoC) and prototype designs while developing a deep understanding of the business opportunity in order to come up with innovative solutions.
      • Provide technical feasibility and effort estimate for proposed deliverables in Salesforce platform
      • Contribute to Salesforce technical governance framework, especially around DevOps practice in Salesforce platform, design and development guideline.
      • Perform post-implementation transition to application operational service team in Sun Life.
      • Maintain and update the necessary system design documentation for applications built in Salesforce platform.

      What you need to succeed:

      • University degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
      • 3+ years of enterprise application design/development experience, including 2+ years in Salesforce Lightning experience configuration, customization, development using Salesforce.com best practices.
      • Deep experience working with many aspects of the Salesforce platform, especially in Financial Services Cloud and Community Cloud (experience with Einstein Analytics also an asset).
      • Proficiency in all aspects of Salesforce.com Lightning development environment including OOTB automation tools, Apex, Triggers, Visual Force, Lightning Components using LWC and SLDS frameworks, data migration approach & tools.
      • Proficiency in integrating Salesforce.com applications with 3rd party system using REST and SOAP web services, event based integration.
      • Software development fundamentals such as knowledge of data structures, object oriented programming, relational database design, and design patterns.
      • Design and development experience using Agile project methodology.
      • Experience with web development technologies like Java, .NET, CSS, JavaScript, HTML, XML, HTML5 Frameworks (Node JS, Bootstrap, Angular etc).
      • Hands-on experience with implementing accessibility compliance web design (i.e., AODA).
      • Experience with development, code management and deployment tools considered an asset (VSCode, GitHub, BitBucket, JIRA, Jenkins, Force.com Migration Tool, ANT Scripting, etc.).
      • Salesforce Certifications:
        • Must Have: Salesforce Certified Administrator, Salesforce Platform Developer 1
        • Nice to Have: Salesforce Platform Developer 2, Salesforce Sales Cloud
          Consultant, Salesforce Community Cloud Consultant

      Preferred skills:

      • Passion, Creativity and Collaboration
      • Self driven and motivated to get results
      • Proven ability to perform design, development, unit testing, implementation and documentation as it relates to Salesforce.com applications
      • Ability to give expert advice and articulate complex ideas and solutions using a variety of media and tools to senior technical and business stakeholders and executives
      • Strong communication skills  (written and verbal) to express ideas, thoughts and questions so that it can be understood by various audiences and meets the customers\' needs
      • Adept at working collaboratively as part of a cross functional team to deliver solutions
      • Adept at working effectively on multi-site teams including offshore teams in India
      • Strong analysis and problem solving skills to break down high-level business requirements into more detail by questioning and probing for clarification
      • Good leadership, planning and consulting skills (business and technical)
      • A strong appreciation of the quickly evolving digital technology landscape and its applicability to businesses and their clients

      Special Notes:

      Occasional weekend / after-hours work may be required to support project implementations, system upgrades and support for production environments.

      What’s in it for you:

      • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
      • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
      • A common sense dress code, where you dictate how you dress based on your day
      • An environment of continuous learning and improvement

      The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

      Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

      Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

      At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

      We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

item.title: Director, Solution Delivery, Connect Advice
item.description:
• Director, Solution Delivery, Connect Advice

      Toronto, Ontario
        Sun Life Financial Waterloo King
      Apply

      • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

        Job Description:

        What will you do?

        Release Planning

        • Create the agile/non-agile implementation deployment plans in collaboration with build squads, scrum master(s), product owner(s) & Program Director
        • Provide oversight on UX delivery with design agency(s) within an established UX process flow, ensuring UI and Dev team is consulted and aware of all UX changes, impacts etc.; Make revisions to plan as needed, based on the associated downstream impact
        • Support the creation of various testing plans (e.g. BAT, performance, vulnerability, penetration testing, etc.), ensuring adequate coverage of all testing scenarios to support business outcomes & growth plans
        • Understand the impact to Business Practice Review (BPR), Privacy Impact Assessment (PIA), Record Impact Assessment (RIA) processes for various platform releases and incorporate the key dates/milestones as part of the release plan

        Execution/Delivery

        • Manage expectations between technology and Business teams around timelines, solution options etc.; Provide clarity and decisions to build, PMO teams, especially when change of direction is required
        • Identify impact of UX and/or Copy revisions delay etc. to the build team and co-ordinate communications around this with Business & technology teams
        • Drive the creation of UX deliverables, copy and content schedules in conjunction with marketing, copy writer and PM
        • Support CA Product Owner in decision making and prioritization with a lens on build, implementation timelines and escalate as needed
        • Sign-off for business production deployment; Making Go/No Go decision and activate escalation procedures as required during deployment
        • Recommendation on the release sign-off (to CA Business leadership) on the performance testing, pen testing, vulnerability testing risks with an understanding of implementation timelines
        • Provide recommendation on activating campaigns (SEO, SEM, Email etc.) based on the ongoing release plan
        • Provide recommendation on the platform licensing, platform user ramp etc. based on CA Business growth plan
        • Monitor and communicative team agility (lead-time, cycle time, velocity etc.) to Business leadership as appropriate
        • Remove blockers and dependencies for the agile room and other delivery teams
        • Coordinate discussions between Business SMEs, build tams PO etc. as needed to reach consensus

        Transformation/Innovation

        • Accountable for UX Process flow and build team hand-off revisions as required
        • Accountable for Agile transformation within the business (foundational training, application/rollout)
        • Identify opportunities for digital innovation e.g., Dev Ops, Data Analytics etc.; Support this roadmap when it is approved
        • Accountable for conducting Lessons Learned in collaboration with Agile Coach, CA Business team and technology organization

        Communication and relationship management

        • Effectively communicate and influence with key insights, ideas and strategies, to an executive level audience within Connect Advice and across internal Canada partners in a clear, compelling and concise manner
        • Proactively stay in touch with internal partners to maintain an understanding of new developments in their areas and identify opportunities for collaboration
        • Tailor both written and verbal communication based on audience and situation to maximize buy-in and establish productive working relationships

        What do you need to succeed?

        • Demonstrated leadership in managing the delivery of projects and working within a matrixed organization
        • Strong leadership, facilitation and collaboration skills with the ability to influence others, especially across organizational boundaries
        • Self-starter with the ability to deal with ambiguity and develop processes and governance from the ground up
        • Ability to focus, prioritize and maintain good judgement in a fast-paced environment, with the ability to adapt quickly and iterate
        • Ability to proactively resolve issues and handle numerous operational tasks and projects concurrently, with minimal to no supervision
        • Develops creative, client centric solutions and/or multiple alternatives and solutions
        • Visibly supports new ideas and seeks better ways to solve problems
        • Incorporates technology and analytic skills into the development of solutions that improve programs and practices and data into actionable insights.
        • Uses business and industry acumen to guide decisions and own work.
        • Leverages quantitative and qualitative information to guide actions of self and others.
        • Assesses complex issues from multiple angles to get the complete picture.
        • Communicates confidently to a wide variety of audiences at all organizational levels.
        • Understands how to accomplish things within the organization’s culture and builds a variety of networks to support performance.
        • Navigates effectively through challenges and involves others to solve problems and achieve goals.
        • Demonstrates ownership for outcomes and uses positive influence to achieve the right results.
        • Delegates assignments and decisions appropriately.
        • Demonstrates perseverance in delivering work and solving problems; recognizes when an 80% solution will work.
        • Effectively communicates to others how accountabilities and desired outcomes are aligned to broader organizational goals.
        • Addresses process breakdowns quickly, identifies the source of problem, and develops solutions that eliminate wasted effort and inefficiencies across teams

        Additional requirements:

        • 8+ years of relevant agile digital delivery experience & technology
        • Strong knowledge of distribution, wealth and /or insurance space
        • Proven track record of implementation experience of Salesforce platform (Lightning and /or Financial Services Cloud) and other sales and distribution technology and platforms
        • Demonstrate knowledge of technology platforms or ability to learn about technology and digital products, experience working on technical products is a plus

        Strategic thinking and analytical skills

        • Proven ability to develop creative, human-centered solutions which balance end-user experience, total cost of ownership, complexity, and speed to market
        • Ability to solve problems effectively by balancing various lenses business, operations, design and technology
        • Possess business acumen to analyze and generate insights from OKRs as well as foundational quantitative analytical skills to develop business cases

        Agile experience

        • Experienced in facilitating agile ceremonies, managing a backlog/release plan, tracking team level metrics, removing blockers
        • SAFe, PMP certification is an asset

        Mindset and behaviors

        • Possess growth mindset and passion to challenge the status quo, find new solutions and drive out-of-the-box ideas
        • Believe in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust
        • Not afraid to “roll up the sleeves” and seeks to go outside comfort zone to learn, pushing teams to do the same
        • Empower self and others to fail, learn, and grow
        • Encourage an experimental mindset to drive innovation
        • Highly collaborative and ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment professionally and positively
        • Bachelors or Masters degree in Business, Information Technology, Computer Science, Software Engineering or other advanced degree in relevant fields

        What\'s in it for you?

        • Joining a reputable organization with over 150 years of history
        • Being part of an organization that offers the best experience by doing what is right and caring for our Clients
        • Being a member of the Sun Life family, a group of people united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives
        • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

        The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

        Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

        Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

        At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

        We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

        102 500/ - 169 200/

item.title: Data Analyst, Group Underwriting
item.description:
• Data Analyst, Group Underwriting

      Toronto, Ontario
        Montreal, Quebec
          Waterloo, Ontario
            Calgary, Alberta
          Apply

          • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

            Job Description:

            We are looking for an energetic, innovative and results-driven candidate to join our Best Practices team in Group Benefits Underwriting. This is a newly created role with abundant opportunities to have a meaningful and lasting impact as a data pioneer in our team, playing a critical role in how we transform Group Underwriting by leveraging data visualisation and analytics to make better decisions, and evolve our processes and tools.

            As a Data Analyst, you embrace continuous improvement and collaboration, you are eager to gain cross-functional skills across different areas of data and reporting analysis, and you have a desire to expand both your business and technical knowledge.

            We look forward to seeing you bring your skills to a variety of tasks and projects, helping us challenge and go beyond the status quo to develop new and unique ways of utilising data and digital processes. Working as part of a diverse, highly-skilled and fun team, your focus will be to support Group Underwriting through:

            • creation and enhancement of Underwriting reports using Tableau;
            • improvement of Underwriting tools (currently in Excel) using programming skills;
            • participation in our projects using data analytics skills

            What will you do?

            Create and enhance Underwriting reports (about 50% of your time) 

            • You will create user-friendly Tableau dashboards by analyzing and collecting pertinent data from multiple systems and help clients visualize their data;
            • You will review our existing metrics reporting and make recommendations how to enhance them to optimize user value;
            • You will support Underwriting with data requests by identifying key data, finding ways to access it and extracting the desired insights;
            • In collaboration with the Best Practices team and other stakeholders, you will identify opportunities to leverage data analysis and reporting to bring further value to our business;
            • You will help migrate Underwriting data to our Enterprise Data Lake;
            • You will coach other team members how to efficiently use Tableau for reporting purposes

            Improve Underwriting tools and processes (about 30% of your time) 

            • You will evaluate some of our existing Excel tools, recommend how to improve them or transition them to better platforms;
            • You will review some of our existing processes and suggest how we can improve efficiency or increase accuracy through automation;
            • You will provide support to users by fixing issues and creating new tools

            Support Underwriting Transformation and other initiatives (about 20% of your time) 

            • You will play a role in our Underwriting Transformation by providing data analytics insights and expertise, as required;
            • You will support other initiatives requiring data analytics and programming skills

            What you need to succeed:

            • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or Engineering
            • 1-3 years experience in Tableau development and design of dashboards, scorecards and KPI’s
            • 1-3 years experience in programming skills used in data manipulation
            • Strong Excel skills in data manipulation and complex formulas including Visual Basic (VBA macros)
            • Experience working with large data sets using SQL, Hive or Hadoop

            Preferred skills

            • Strong analytics skills with the ability to solve complex problems
            • Working in an agile development environment including rapid prototyping
            • Attention to detail
            • Strong written and oral communication
            • Strong organization skills and ability to multi-task
            • Knowledge of C++, Java, R, Python or similar
            • Knowledge of AWS Sagemaker
            • Knowledge of Group Benefits or Group Underwriting would be an asset
            • Being fluent in French would be an asset

              The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

item.title: Senior Associate Actuary, Defined Benefit Solutions, Pricing
item.description:
• Senior Associate Actuary, Defined Benefit Solutions, Pricing

      Toronto, Ontario
        Montreal, Quebec
          Waterloo, Ontario
        Apply

        • You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

          Job Description:

          Sun Life’s Defined Benefit Solutions (DBS) business develops and implements innovative de-risking solutions for defined benefit pension plans including the largest same-day group annuity transaction in the Canadian market to be placed with a single insurer. To support this growing business, which sits within a high-growth market, Sun Life is seeking a Senior Actuarial Associate/Senior Associate Actuary, Structuring.

          Reporting to the Director, DBS, Structuring, the successful candidate will lead the development and enhancement of various tools, models, and processes, contribute to efforts to explore, develop and structure innovative solutions, and assist in special projects related to our group annuity and longevity insurance products.

          The ideal candidate is intellectually curious, possesses superior technical skills and is keen to use cutting-edge research, analytics and technology to develop practical solutions that drive business outcomes.

          What will you do?

          • Lead the research, development and operationalization of enhancements to existing tools, models and business processes

          • Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis to support accurate and timely delivery of group annuity and longevity insurance quotations

          • Collaborate with internal partners and stakeholders to explore new technologies, evaluate data sources, develop analytics and extract actionable insights to advance the development, design and pricing of new products

          • Contribute to the efforts to assess the impact of the IFRS 17 accounting framework on the DBS business and support its implementation

          What do you need to succeed?

          • Undergraduate degree or higher in actuarial science, statistics, or other related mathematical disciplines

          • FSA or near FSA designation

          • At least 3 years of actuarial work experience (preferably in a pension consulting or insurance environment)

          • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including Visual Basic for Applications (VBA)

          • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and demonstrated ability to think creatively to resolve issues and challenge the status quo

          • Experience using one or more statistical programming languages (e.g., R/Python) and AXIS would be a plus

          • Self-motivated, organized and able to manage multiple tasks with a high degree of accuracy in a dynamic environment

          • Values diversity and inclusion and strives to build an inclusive and respectful workplace

          The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.
